result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas G. Rice

defendant.name: Rice, Douglas G.
defendant.address: 695 N. Main Street, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.addlTxt:
11:46 AM Defendant Douglas G. Rice in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Candice C.M. Tlustosch in court for Douglas G. Rice. Attorney T asks for additional more time to get the discovery.  Attorney T states that she is not available on the 7th of September. Court states that the jury trail will not be scheduled on the 7th.

Attorney T speaks about bond and states concern about mortgage on the home. Attorney T states that the defendant would like to go home and notes that there are two separate apartments in the home. Attorney T asks for contact with the victim only for exchanges with their child. Attorney T request that DR be able to use that apartment or in alternative for DR to pick up and drop off their child. 

Attorney Forehand states that this is the first time that she has heard about an apartment. The state or victim witness coordinator has not had contact with the victim about the apartment. Attorney Forehand objects to the apartment at this time. Attorney Forehand doesn't objects to exchanges being on the public road. 

Court comments and states that if victim coordinator and the State speak with the victim and the victim agrees then the state can file a stipulation to change bond.

Court states that if the defendant pulls up to the home and doesn't get out of the car for the sole purpose of picking up a child he is not in violation of the bond.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: in Support of Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:46 PM Defendant Douglas G. Rice in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  DR has received the complaints along with the police reports. Max penalties stated. DR would like to waive counsel. Attorney Forehand would be willing to speak to DR. DR enters a plea of NG.

Attorney Forehand states that DR has request a modification of the bail. DR would like to be able to go home. Attorney Forehand states that the victim hasn't requested that the no contact to be dropped. Attorney Forehand stated that prior procedure to have the victim go to passages to remove the no contact. Court states that the victim should go to passages before the court review the request to modify the bond. 

DR may call Attorney Forehand on 05/27/22 at 11 AM.

DR asks about picking up their daughter on weekends. Court states that this could be handled in a separate action. Court will speak about this on June 1, 2022.
Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

From DR requesting a bail review hearing

Court set a bail hrg/ initial appearance date on 05/17/22 at 1:30 per Judge Day
